abstracts.abstract:
(1) Existing law authorized the County of Napa, until June 30, 2007, to meet up to 15 percent of its existing share of the regional housing need for lower income households in a specified manner.

This bill would repeal this expired authority.

(2) Existing law designates the Department of Housing and Community Development as the state agency responsible for administering funds received by the state from the federal Housing Trust Fund pursuant to the Housing and Economic Recovery Act of 2008, and requires the department to submit an allocation plan for the distribution of those funds, as specified, to the Assembly Committee on Housing and Community Development and the Senate Transportation and Housing Committees.

This bill would update the name of the Senate Housing Committee within these provisions.

actions.description: Introduced. Read first time. To Com. on RLS. for assignment. To print.
From printer. May be acted upon on or after March 16.

extras.impact_clause: An act to repeal Section 65584.6 of the Government Code and to amend Section 50676 of the Health and Safety Code, relating to housing.
